title: Brook criticises 'worst ever' pitch after ODI win
byline: England captain Harry Brook criticised the pitch used for the second one-day international against Sri Lanka in Colombo, calling it ’’probably the worst’’ he had ever played on.

title: LIVE Updates: SL vs ENG 2nd ODI – Steady Root helps England level ODI series in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka vs England 2nd ODI Highlights: Joe Root starred with bat and ball to help England beat Sri Lanka by five wickets and level their ODI series.

title: “If you are Bruce Lee, I am Mike Tyson,” - Chamara Sampath challenges Lalkantha
byline: Former Minister and Member of Parliament Chamara Sampath Dassanayake issued a fiery challenge to Minister K.D. Lalkantha during a public gathering, declaring, “If you are Bruce Lee, I am Mike Tyson,” in response to remarks attributed to the Minister.

title: GMOA’s 48-hour island-wide token strike ends
byline: The 48-hour island-wide token strike launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) concluded at 8.00 a.m. today, the association announced.

title: Drugs worth Rs. 133.94 million seized at BIA, three arrested
byline: Three passengers attempting to smuggle a consignment of “Kush” and “Hashish” valued at approximately Rs. 133.94 million through the Green Channel at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), were arrested by airport Customs officers this morning (25).

title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs if it ’makes a deal with China’
byline: US President Donald Trump has threatened to slap a 100% tariff on Canadian goods if the country strikes a trade deal with China.

title: Indonesia–Sri Lanka peacekeepers hold dialogue aboard Indonesian Navy ship
byline: Indonesian Navy ship KRI Sultan Iskandar Muda (SIM-367) berthed in Colombo following the completion of its one-year deployment with MTF TNI Konga XXVIII-P/UNIFIL 2024/2025.

title: International Finance Corporation commits $166m to boost Sri Lanka’s private sector
byline: The International Finance Corporation (IFC), a member of the World Bank Group, has announced a $166 million high-impact investment program aimed at strengthening Sri Lanka’s private sector and supporting the country’s transition from economic stabilization to sustainable growth.

title: Salman Ali Agha named captain as Pakistan T20 World Cup squad unveiled
byline: The announcement was made in a press conference by PCB High Performance Director and member of the men’s national selection committee Aqib Javed, who was speaking alongside skipper Salman and white-ball head coach Michael James Hesson at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore.

title: Two Indian Coast Guard  ships arrive at Colombo Port
byline: The Indian Coast Guard Ships (ICGS) Varaha and Atulya arrived at the Port of Colombo for an official visit and welcomed in accordance with naval traditions by the Navy

title: Govt ready to work against local culture, religion for its survival: Namal
byline: The present government is ready to work against the local culture and religions for its survival, SLPP National Organiser Namal Rajapaksa said.

title: United States’ withdrawal from WHO will make world less safe: WHO
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) said it regrets the United States’ notification of withdrawal from WHO – a decision that makes both the United States and the world less safe.

title: Sulipuram Army Camp disbanded after three decades
byline: The Sri Lanka Army has completely vacated the Sulipuram Army Camp (also referred to as Chulipuram), a facility that had been operational for over 30 years.

title: Channa Jayasumana slams Parliament Deputy Secretary General’s removal
byline: Former MP Prof. Channa Jayasumana voiced strong opposition to the removal of the Deputy Secretary General of Parliament, alleging that the action was taken without due process.

title: US climber scales Taiwan’s tallest building Taipei 101 without ropes
byline: U.S. climber Alex Honnold scaled the Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes or safety netting on Sunday, watched by thousands of cheering and waving fans as he clambered up one of the world’s tallest buildings.

title: GMOA to launch island-wide indefinite strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) has announced that it will commence an island-wide indefinite trade union action from 8.00 a.m. tomorrow (January 26), citing the Ministry of Health’s failure to implement agreed solutions.

title: Modules under new education reforms not started by NPP government: Deputy Minister
byline: Claiming that the modules under the new education reforms were not started by the National People’s Power (NPP) government, Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe said today the government only changed them to align with the policies of the government.
